Title: THE SUDAN CRISIS
Description:
In this video, we discuss a brief overview of Sudan's modern history followed by the current humanitarian crisis ongoing in Sudan right now.

This video is NOT part of the summer of True Crime.

* Sudan history information sources:

https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/resources/the-world-factbook/geos/su.html

https://www.wikiwand.com/en/Sudan

* Current crisis sources:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pp8gRbMnTUU

https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/06/happening-sudan-unrest-190603091106565.html

https://pbs.twimg.com/media/D84vaZEWsAAl9v8?format=jpg&name=large

https://www.fastcompany.com/90363335/sudan-massacre-how-to-help-7-things-from-gofundme-to-unicef


- WHAT YOU CAN DO -

Donate to the following campaigns:

* Bakri Aliâ€™s campaign for medical aid of all wounded protestors

https://www.facebook.com/donate/977085802497357/

* Donate to the GoFundMe campaign for medical needs for the sit-ins

https://www.gofundme.com/medical-assist-for-sit-in

* Donate to the GoFundMe campaign bringing medical aid to Sudan

https://www.gofundme.com/emergency-medical-aid-for-sudan

* Donate to UNICEF, which is working to help the children displaced by the conflict

https://donate.unicefusa.org/page/contribute/support-south-sudans-children-16206?_ga=2.178890276.1841365715.1560358649-277415570.1560358649

* Donate to Save the Children, who has been working in Sudan since 1984

https://www.savethechildren.org/us/what-we-do/where-we-work/africa/sudan

* Donate to the International Rescue Committee who has been in Sudan since 1989,

https://www.rescue.org/country/south-sudan


* Sign the following Change.org petition, demanding that â€œThe UN must investigate the 3rd of June human rights violations in Sudan by the Military.â€

https://www.change.org/p/ant%C3%B3nio-guterres-the-secretary-general-of-the-united-nations-the-un-must-investigate-the-3rd-of-june-human-rights-violations-in-sudan-by-the-military


* Call your member of Congress. Call 202-224-3121. State your zip code. When connected, tell them you support helping the people of Sudan or send them George Clooneyâ€™s essay.
* Use ResistBotÂ to text your members of Congress.Â Text RESIST to 50409 and it will help you contact your elected officials and tell them to help the people of Sudan.

Title: A 7 YEAR OLD GIRL VANISHES! | The Curious Case of: Nikki Allan
Description:
Enjoy this video??? Subscribe â–º  https://goo.gl/EQkjMH

â†“Â Drop down for more details! â†“Â 


Iâ€™m sorry the audio is noisy and a bit rubbish at times. I didnâ€™t realize till after Iâ€™d filmed and I wasnâ€™t prepared to sit down for another 3 hours to re-record. Also the lighting changes halfway through bc the sun decided to set on me which honestly is rude.

Also when I said central I meant chicago time. sorry. im not good with timezones.

Okay so thereâ€™s a bunch more information on this case that I thought I should include so here it is. These are extracts of info from Reddit or Guardian articles on the case.

Many of the locals in Sunderland believe that Sharronâ€™s strong dialect, plain looks and poor background made her unappealing to an ever image-conscious media. Whether this is true or not, Sharon has continued to campaigned through outthe decades to keep her daughterâ€™s face and case in the public eye. She has been warned on several occasions for naming suspects in her daughterâ€™s case on Facebook and consequently has a not too good relationship with the police.

Sharon had campaigned to change the double jeopardy rule and she knew that if the blood found on Heron's shoes and clothes 14 years ago were to be re-examined, it might be possible to confirm whether or not the blood was Nikki's. In the light of the change in the law, and scientific advances, Sharon waited for the police to come and tell her they would reopen the case. "Because of the change in the law they suddenly had a chance to reinvestigate", she says, "but I heard nothing from them." By 2002, prompted by advances in DNA testing, Sharon was sending at least one letter a month to the police, the Home Office and even the Queen. She shows me a sympathetic letter from Cherie Booth, whom she wrote to "as one mother to another. That gave me a boost, but I was still in limbo."

In June 2006, Sharon became so desperate that she told the local press she would be pushing for her daughter's body to be exhumed so that DNA left on her body could be re-examined. In response, police said they would not support the request. Sharon then persuaded a high- profile lawyer to take on her case, which was reported in her local paper. Two days after the story appeared, police called at Sharon's home to tell her they were looking at the case as part of a "regular review". "It was news to me", she says, "that they had been looking at it at all since the trial. I had heard nothing until that day."

As far as DNA use in policing in the U.K., weâ€™re generally considered at the forefront of its use. The police have a (controversial) DNA database that holds the DNA of any convicted criminal on file for life. It also holds DNA of suspects, even once eliminated (hence the controversy). However, these things are at a national level and are only used on a regional level in exceptional cases (mostly due to resource limits, rather than anything else).

Iâ€™m under the impression they do not have Heronâ€™s DNA and getting it now would involve his consent or a warrant; and they would only get the latter if there was significant new evidence connecting him to the case.
